submitted by: TURNER7@AppleLink.Apple.COM Here's an old recipe that my mom passed down to me. You can tell it's old because it asks you to start in a cold oven and uses oleo (mom said that was used during WWII). I request this for my birthday every year.
APPLE NUT CAKE: (Don't use mixer and begin in cold oven.) Mix oil, sugar and eggs. Add apples and nuts. Sift flour, salt and soda; add sifted mixture to above 1/3 at a time, then add 2 tsp. vanilla. Bake in 325! oven (start cold) for 1 1/2 hours in greased tube pan. After cooling, poke holes all over and cover with glaze (below).
BROWN SUGAR GLAZE: Cook butter and sugar over low heat until butter melts. Add evaporated milk. Bring to hard boil. Cool and stir; beat with a spoon. Add vanilla. Pour slowly over cake - EAT!!
